section.name: Introduction
section.p: Moria is implemented as a web service, thus requires that the web service uses SOAP to talk to Moria. The easiest way to use Moria is to use a SOAP implementation for the same programming language used by the service (that are going to use Moria). See the last section for more information about SOAP implementations for different programming languages.

Normally the SOAP implementation contains tools for generating stubs from the WSDL interface. The stubs works as the local representation of Moria and makes the communication between the web service and Moria totally transparent. How to use the stubs varies between SOAP implementations thus the SOAP implementation's documentation contains important documentation to understand how to use a webservice as Moria.
